body_html:
I think the pip package is outdated; the particular issue you describe (graphs tab works, events tab never works) is fixed in a newly-built pip package, and we will rebuild the pip package before release. However, in the local testing I'm doing, Safari is pretty spotty, I think because it doesn't play well with webcomponents/Polymer. We don't currently consider Safari a supported browser so I don't invest much in making sure that it's working. But both Chrome and FF are fine.

If you feel strongly that we should be supporting Safari please say so. (Especially if you are willing to do the work to improve support :) )

body:
I think the pip package is outdated; the particular issue you describe (graphs tab works, events tab never works) is fixed in a newly-built pip package, and we will rebuild the pip package before release. However, in the local testing I'm doing, Safari is pretty spotty, I think because it doesn't play well with webcomponents/Polymer. We don't currently consider Safari a supported browser so I don't invest much in making sure that it's working. But both Chrome and FF are fine.

If you feel strongly that we should be supporting Safari please say so. (Especially if you are willing to do the work to improve support :) )
